reference.title: Renaming a folder, a dictionary or a Translation Memory

section.title: Purpose
section.indexterm: organizingOTMBATCH: Renaming a folder, a dictionary or a Translation Memory (from command area)
section.p: If you want to rename a folder, a dictionary or a Translation Memory using a command typed in your system's command area instead of windows might be quicker and more convenient.

refsyn.title: Format
refsyn.indexterm: OTMBATCHrename a folder, a dictionary or a Translation Memory
commandsOTMBATCHrename a folder, a dictionary or a Translation Memory
refsyn.p: The following syntax diagram describes how you rename a folder, a dictionary or a TranslationMemory with the OTMBATCH command. Note that lowercase letters in a parameter name are optional and need not be typed.

syntaxdiagram.title: For the rename of Translation Memory databases:

section.title: Parameters

plentry.pd: RENAME specifies that you want to rename a folder, dictionary or a TranslationMemory.
Specifies the name of the folder that you want to rename.
Specifies the name of the dictionary that you want to rename.
Specifies the name of the Translation Memory that you want to rename.
Specifies the new name for the folder, dictionary or Translation Memory.
When specified OTMBATCH will change all occurences of the TranslationMemory name or dictionary name in the properties of folders and documents

If you specify the parameter in this format, you are not prompted with any message window. If you do not specify any of the /quiet paramaters, a message window pops up whenever an error occurs or when the task has successfully completed.
If you specify this parameter, you are not prompted with any message window. Any error message text is routed to stdout.

section.note: You can type the commands in uppercase, lowercase, or in mixed-case letters. You may not use any wildcard characters, such as an asterisk (*).

example.title: Examples
example.p: The following example shows how to rename a folder using the OTMBATCH command.
In this example, the folder pharma is renamed to pharmaceutical without prompting the user.
The following example shows how to rename a TranslationMemory and adjust all references to the Translation Memory name automatically.
In this example, the Translation Memory MyMem is renamed to MyNewMem and all references to this memory in the properties of folders and documents are adjusted to use the new name.
